item.title: Read Global Objects from a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

Can Anyone make me something that read’s my .txt file

this code below is how it save its maybe you need

public void POHMapper(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ try { createNewTileObject(x,y,typeID,orientation,tileObjectType); BufferedWriter bufferedwriter; bufferedwriter = null; bufferedwriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./data/writed/pohs.txt", true)); bufferedwriter.write((new StringBuilder()).append("makeGlobalObject(").append(absX).append(",").append(absY).append(",").append(typeID).append(",").append(orientation).append(",").append(tileObjectType).append(");").toString()); bufferedwriter.newLine(); bufferedwriter.flush(); } catch(Exception e) { System.out.println("error writing to Construction file..."); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Read Global Objects from a .txt file

item.title: Read Global Objects from a .txt file
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

You could try reading it with a FileReader, storing the loaded items into an array, and than call the method with a loop.

Something perhaps,
int[] coords = new int[100];
String inFile;
for(int i = 0; i > 100; i++) {
while((inFile = in readLine()) != null) {
coords[i] = Integer.parseInt(inFile));
}
}

Of course that will not work, but it’s just a idea “exampler”.

Read full topic
